VIII.ii.2.C.2.a
.
When Presumptive SC Cannot Be Established
As discussed in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart ii, 2.A.1.d
, SC cannot be established on a presumptive basis if
the Veteran
did not serve in a qualifying location as listed in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart ii, 2.A.1.e
, or
is not diagnosed with a presumptive BPOT
disability
there is affirmative evidence that the BPOT
disability
was caused by another condition or event that occurred between the Veteran’s qualifying service and the onset of the disability, or
was the result of the Veteran’s own willful misconduct or the abuse of alcohol or drugs.
Reference
:  For more information on establishing SC under
38 U.S.C. 1120
, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart ii, 2.A
, and
VBA Letter 20-24-06
.
